Name: Professional Inheritance
Description:
Uncle Dong has found a treasure left by an ancient person. This could prove to be a must-see of his stall, "Thus Says the Moon".

Unlock a new Companion after completing this quest.
QuestDesc:
Uncle Dong has found a treasure left by an ancient person. This could prove to be a must-see of his stall, "Thus Says the Moon".

Unlock a new Companion after completing this quest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. Though I do practice Taoism, geomancy and fortune-telling aren't my strong suit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Moreover, this matter concerns chance, and you can't force it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Sigh, then I'll come up with something else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That might be the best solution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hi, {PlayerName}. It's nothing big. Uncle Dong asked me to help him decipher a divination lot, but… I'm not skilled in that art.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a long story. Although I know a bit of divination, I'm self-taught. So, I decided to find something to lend some credibility to my efforts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. Long ago, a famous diviner visited Jinzhou, rumored to possess the gift of communicating with spirits and predicting destinies. People flocked to him for guidance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His moon-reading skill was said to be exceptional. Uh, I guess you're not familiar with it, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You half fill a specially crafted porcelain bowl with pure water, recite an incantation, and observe the reflection of the full moon in the water to discern fortune and misfortune. That's the moon-reading divination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When that diviner performed it, the water would emit a golden glow, adding a touch of mystery to the moon's reflection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, no one knew where he went. It's said that when he left Jinzhou, he left a letter and a divination lot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the letter, he mentioned meeting a mysterious person in Jinzhou. After a deep conversation on divination, he felt his understanding was too shallow and lost interest in reading divination books.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Frustrated, he decided to give up his career, but he couldn't bear to part with the porcelain bowl that had accompanied him for years. So, he hid it somewhere in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, he left a divination lot as a clue, hoping someone would find it one day.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is that the divination lot you wanted Jianxin to decipher?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. Since the bowl belongs to that famous master, it must be great for divinations. So I want to have it on my stall and enhance my credibility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I haven't heard of this divination master, Uncle Dong does have a point. In this line of work, possessing powerful artifacts does lend credibility to one's abilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I bet that master would be happy to see his treasure recognized by people again.

Options.PlotLineKey: What did the divination lot say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, haha, I almost forgot our main business. It says, "To seek your true self, observe the lake at a deck. Place your trust in innocent young souls."

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This lot doesn't seem related to fortune-telling, so I'm a bit confused. Any thoughts, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A deck where people can appreciate the lake… Do we have a place like that in Jinzhou?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been to several places that match the description. Found nothing so far. Perhaps the time wasn't right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, as long as we have a clue, there's a way to find it! Uncle Dong, we'll help you find that porcelain bowl!

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, you can count on us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great! I'll be sure to pay you a hefty sum! Best of luck, Jianxin, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Observe the lake at a deck"… Seems like this is the place the divination lot implies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the next line… " The pure heart of a child shouldn't be doubted." We may need to look for children nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. There might be clues around here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lalala…

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello there, little girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi? How can I help you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something strange…? I come here a lot, but something strange...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, yeah! The cats!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cats…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, that's right! There's a spot around here where cats love to stay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Often saw them just sitting there, not moving at all. Mom said they're fishing in the lake but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cats… What's your take, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A-are you Patrollers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A-are you bad people, then...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, of course not. We're here for a long-lost treasure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A treasure?! That sounds cool!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A treasure?! That sounds cool!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Mommy probably won't let me join you. Never mind, I'll cheer you on from the sidelines!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, young miss. We'll definitely find the treasure!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl by the Lake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "My cart dust-covered…" Oh, look, there's an old cart. Looks like it hasn't been maintained for years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go search around!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found it, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another wooden casket. But it feels way too light... Don't tell me there's another piece of paper inside…

Options.PlotLineKey: That master really thought he was being funny, I guess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Seeking my true self, I travel wide. In the stall where fortunes amass, emptiness resides." This must be the next clue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In the stall where fortunes amass…" That probably means the Main Street?

Options.PlotLineKey: You're getting good at reading divination lots!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, just a guess. We still don't know if I got it right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure! We'll find out soon enough!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are so many stores on the Main Street… I guess we have to search them one by one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on, Jianxin. Since it says "in the stall" we can probably cross out large stores from our list.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good point. We should focus on the small vendor stalls, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you're right. The clue does point to a vendor stall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This wooden casket is heavy. I think the porcelain bowl is inside. Shall we open it, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The treasure left by that divination master is inside… The thought makes me a bit nervous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Jianxin open the wooden casket. Inside there is an ordinary looking black porcelain bowl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this the treasure we've been searching for? But it looks…

Options.PlotLineKey: It looks like an ordinary porcelain bowl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Just as the saying goes, "Great music has the faintest notes; the Great Form is without shape." Maybe the more precious the treasure, the less eye-catching it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps it only shines when used in divination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, let's bring it back to Uncle Dong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is it. Thank you for your help, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh... I wanted to see the legendary golden glow and its extraordinary power, but it turns out to be just an ordinary bowl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, a little bit. But Uncle Dong seemed happy. Maybe that ordinary bowl is indeed a treasure to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, I'm more embarrassed than frustrated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been with me the whole time, searching and solving riddles, but we've just come up empty...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! I can't just let it go. I must repay you somehow for all the work you've done for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But how… well, let me think…

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! I know! I just got a new paycheck. I should treat you to a meal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Order whatever you like!

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're back! How's it going? Did you find the bowl?

Options.PlotLineKey: It doesn't look like a treasure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. It's okay. According to the record, we need to fill it with fresh water and recite the moon-reading incantation…

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the moon casts its reflection on the water, you'll witness its magic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, that sounds amazing! Hurry, let's try it out, Uncle Dong!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle Dong fills the porcelain bowl halfway with water and recites the incantation, but nothing happens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, where's the golden glow…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Well, I'm certain the bowl you found is the one left by that master of divination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, it seems to be an ordinary bowl used for divination, and that's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How can that be…

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm actually not surprised the bowl didn't work. These kind of stories are usually just hearsay, and it looks like this one is no different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That master might have been good at divination, but people exaggerated his skills.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I love operas and shows, but come on—heroes performing impossible feats and warriors moving mountains? It's all embellished for entertainment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you mean the bowl is useless?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, far from it! While it may not have "magic," it's still a treasure worth cherishing. Remember, what defines a treasure is not its practicality, young one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the story behind it that matters. A good story. A story rich in twists and turns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I see now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, thank you, {PlayerName}, Jianxin. Thank you for helping me find this bowl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncle Dong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the presence of this porcelain bowl, my reputation as a professional fortune-teller will surely flourish!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! I found it! It's a wooden casket. Hmm? What is that smell?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be some kind of medicine in here that lasts a long time and attracts cats.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's interesting, but I just don't get it... Could someone actually predict a kid would solve this puzzle years later?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe he trusted a child's curiosity.
Maybe there indeed was a way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True. Kids have pure hearts, free from adult worries. They often have a keen eye for details that we miss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My master was right; divination isn't just about lies and trickery… Sadly, I'm not gifted with the talent to fully master it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we open this casket? We may find the porcelain bowl inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Jianxin open the porcelain bowl. However, except for some herbs wrapped in silk pouches, there is only a yellowed piece of paper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I seek my true self, but the paths are unclear. Blurring my vision, fueling my fear. I hesitate, I question, and I wander. My cart dust-covered, yet no path feels right, I ponder." Seems quite similar to that divination lot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't seem to figure out what is says. Any idea, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great! Knew I can count on you!
